business.headline: Haldiram's attracts bids from Alpha Wave, 2 others for 15-20% stake: ReportThe bids, which could mark one of India's largest private-equity deals, peg the company's valuation at Rs 75,000-80,000 crore ($8.8-9.4 billion).

November blues for mutual funds as equity inflows down 14%: AMFI data Investment through systematic investment plans (SIPs) remained steady in November. Total SIP inflows stood at Rs 25,319.66 crore, showing little change from October's Rs 25,323 crore.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: NDA has majority: Kiren Rijiju on no-confidence motion against Jagdeep DhankharThe Congress-led INDIA bloc submitted the no-confidence motion on Tuesday, citing "partisan functioning" by the Rajya Sabha Chairman. However, Kiren Rijiju clamped down on the motion, asserting that the NDA has the majority in the Upper House.

False murder case, harassment by wife: What Bengaluru techie's suicide note saysThe 24-page suicide note left behind by Atul Subhash intricately details his years-long emotional distress from marital issues and multiple cases filed against him.

BJP slams Arvind Kejriwal over Chief Minister's house, shares video; AAP reactsThe renovation of Delhi Chief Minister's residence incurred a total cost of Rs 52.71 crore, according to a "factual report" submitted by the Delhi government's Vigilance Directorate to the lieutenant governor last year in 2023.

No discrepancy in VVPAT slips in Maharashtra polls: Election CommissionAccording to the reports received from all 36 District Election Officers in Maharashtra, the candidate-wise number of votes recorded in the Electronic Voting Machines (EVMs) matched perfectly with the VVPAT slips in all constituencies.

Why techies in India's Silicon Valley Bengaluru should say Krishna, KrishnaSM Krishna, who passed away on Tuesday, developed Karnataka's IT sector during his tenure as the Chief Minister. A farmer's son, Krishna regarded computers and IT as two powerful tools and was instrumental in transforming Bengaluru into India's Silicon Valley.

Nurse going to hospital, teen returning home: Victims of Mumbai bus accidentA bus crash in Mumbai's Kurla area on Monday night killed six people, including a Mumbai Bus Accident: 19-year-old teen and a 55-year-old nurse, and left 43 others injured. The driver, Sanjay More, has been arrested. Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis announced compensation for the victims' families.

Intelligence officer behind bomb hoax to Kolkata-Nagpur IndiGo flightThe accused, Animesh Mandal, a deputy superintendent-rank IB officer posted in Nagpur, was arrested by Raipur Police under Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita Section 351(4) and provisions of the Suppression of Unlawful Acts against Safety of Civil Aviation Act, 1982.

Supreme Court takes note of High Court judge's controversial remarks at VHP eventChief Justice of India (CJI) Sanjiv Khanna received complaints seeking appropriate action against Justice Shekhar Kumar Yadav for his speech targeting a particular community at a VHP event.

Will the vacuum after the fall of the Assad regime see the growth of the group now contained in small pockets? NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.
